subject: Re: [junit] htmlunit
msgSnippet: Paul, Thank you for your clarification. I declare that I must have been confused. It s happened before and I m sure it ll happen again. :-) Simon ... --
messageBody:
Paul,

Thank you for your clarification. I declare that I must have been confused.
It's happened before and I'm sure it'll happen again. :-)

Simon

On 8/25/07, Paul King <paulk@...> wrote:
>
> Simon Chappell wrote:
> > Paul,
> >
> > Is this new? I thought that when I checked out HtmlUnit a couple of
> years
> > ago, it was built on top of HttpUnit, but I have a very bad memory! In
> light
> > of your information I will take a fresh look at HtmlUnit. Thank you.
>
> As far as I know there was never any common code between the two.
>
> WebTest used to use HttpUnit under the covers but moved to HtmlUnit
> because of (among other things) its better JavaScript support. That
> move was quite a few years ago. I don't know if that is what you are
> thinking about. Or perhaps you are thinking about Apache HttpClient
> which is used by HtmlUnit under the covers.
>
> Paul.
>
> > On 8/24/07, Paul King <paulk@... <paulk%40asert.com.au><mailto:
> paulk% <paulk%25>40asert.com.au>>
> > wrote:
> > >
> > >
> > > Actually, htmlunit and httpunit are quite different implementations.
> > > The latest htmlunit does most JavaScript these days but quite possibly
> > > not all. I have used it to test Ajax applications. Actually, via some
> > > layers but using HtmlUnit underneath:
> > >
> > > DSL -> Groovy -> WebTest -> HtmlUnit
> > >
> > > Paul.
> > >
> > > Simon Chappell wrote:
> > > > On 8/21/07, hi@... <hi%40hi.com> <mailto:hi%40hi.com>
> <hi%40hi.com>
> > <mailto:hi%40hi.com> <
> > > jobs4wil@... <jobs4wil%40yahoo.com> <mailto:jobs4wil%<jobs4wil%25>
> 40yahoo.com> <jobs4wil%40yahoo.com>
> > > > <mailto:jobs4wil% <jobs4wil%25> <jobs4wil%25>40yahoo.com>> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > > Hi,
> > > > > Can you someone tell me if anyone has used htmlunit to
> > > > > test ajax web applications? If so, does htmlunit work
> > > > > with heavy javascript applications? And how does your
> > > > > organization like it/support it? Is it easy to
> > > > > maintain?
> > > >
> > > > I've had no luck with testing JavaScript-heavy applications using
> > > > HttpUnit (which HtmlUnit is based upon) so I'll be interested to
> hear
> > > > if anyone has managed to get it to work.
> > > >
> > > > Simon
> > >
> > >
> >
> > --
> > simonpeter.org | simonpeter.com | newlife-upc.org
> >
> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> >
> >
>
>
>



--
simonpeter.org | simonpeter.com | newlife-upc.org
